<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:236164508</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-LCY</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Daniel, Dorothy.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>[Letter, 1955 Jan. 20 : to Daniel S. Tiger].</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Handwritten letter saying that "The Children's Corner" is a success because Fred Rogers and Josie Carey have the talent and greatness needed.  Dorothy Daniel helped them start the show because she knew it would be good for WQED. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Lehigh Carbon Community College Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
